conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container E or F after passing through baffles.
The image shows four inlets labeled A (green), B (yellow), C (blue), and D (light blue) at the top, baffles positioned diagonally, and two containers labeled E (white) and F (blue) at the bottom.
Liquid flows from inlets A, B, C, and D at the top.
Liquid from inlet A flows downward, following the path formed by the baffles, avoiding obstructions, and continues towards the lower section of the container.
Liquid from inlet B flows downward, navigating towards the right side of the container and joins the flow from inlet C.
Liquid from inlet C flows downward and merges with the flow from inlet B.
Liquid from inlet D flows downward along the rightmost path and joins the flow from inlets B and C.
The combined flow from inlets B, C, and D merges and is directed towards the right side.
The flow from inlet A, while initially directed towards the left, is influenced by the presence of obstacles and joins the main flow towards the right.
The combined flow from all inlets merges and moves towards the rightmost container.
The liquid flows into container F.
